2 Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) 2.1 Introduction to GWAS

2 Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) 2.1 Introduction to GWAS 2.1.1 Some Vocabulary There are many terms that come along with talking about genetic data. The following are terms to remember as you read this unit summary. Refer to this list if you forget what a term means. SNPs (single nucleotide polymorphisms): a single nucleotide at a specific position in the genome Genome: complete set of genes or genetic material Chromosome: condensed DNA structure, all chromosomes together is the genome Genetic variants: positions where DNA sequences differ SNV (single nucleotide variant): a single nucleotide change in the DNA sequence. SNP and SNV are typically used interchangeably. You might see SNP used in instances where the minor allele is not too rare Allele: the different possible nucleotides at some position. The combinations are A with T and G with C Minor allele: at this location, which allele is the least common MAF (minor allele frequency): the frequency of the minor allele, can get very small Loci/locus: means location, can be used to refer to a single SNP or a larger region in the genome
